Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury -- 1% S&U - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Winn, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), under applicable constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing March 1, 2014, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible property and on sales of services in the Parish, as defined by law, (an estimated $1,774,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the costs of collecting the Tax), to be allocated and divided as follows (i) 60% to the Parish for first, constructing, acquiring, maintaining, improving and operating a solid waste collection and disposal system for the Parish, with the balance of the proceeds for maintaining and supporting the Winn Parish Courthouse and providing other Parish services, and (ii) 40% to the City of Winnfield for providing solid waste collection and disposal, including the operation, maintenance and improvement of its Waste Compaction Station, and for providing other municipal services?
